author: Matias Falcone
title: ALDEA Wiki - Cardano Encyclopedia
description: There is no place where to find all the documentation and information being produced by an ever growing Cardano community.

assessments.note: Creating such a page is a good idea, yet, aren't there any other projects trying to achieve the same? Just to avoid duplicity. But I strongly believe that such a page can increase the number of proposers.

This proposal addresses the challenge by bringing global diversity to the community.  It curates the information and documentation concerning the cardano community into a Wiki which leverags an existing network (ALDEA) and focuses on Latin America and the Spanish language speakers.  I find that it is very difficult to find quality and trust worthy information by simply browsing google search results and youtube. This is a real problem and a real solution.  This wiki will be a valuable resource for the community, especially Spanish speakers.

While I find this proposal very interesting, I struggle a bit to see exactly how the creation of a Cardano Encyclopaedia will bring new entrepreneurs to Ideascale. Otherwise, I find the whole endeavour well-thought and still consider it to be a a good addition to the entire Catalyst project.
assessments.reply: The Proposal explains how we impact the challenge metrics and how we address the challenge question in the "Checklist" section: "Phase 1 of ALDEA Wiki aims to create an initial set of articles with focus on Project Catalyst and everything proposers need to know about it, among other topics. In order to do this, we'll leverage the content being created as part of the ALDEA Catalyst project. This will generate awareness and encourage entrepreneurs to submit proposals."

assessments.note: This seems a like a good idea to provide for a major language group.
There is a scope to use Wikipedia for hosting articles in Spanish regarding Cardano. The availability of articles and information is not the major reason for non-participation.
assessments.reply: Although we have marked this review as "Constructive feedback" because we agree that "The availability of articles and information is not the major reason for non-participation" in Project Catalyst, we understand that this Advisor doesn't know about the problems that the Cardano Community and even Charles Hoskinson himself had with Wikipedia before. Probably we should have mentioned that in our Proposal because that also has encouraged our team to build this Wiki for the Community.

assessments.note: The proposal itself is not targeted at reaching out to new entrepreneurs, but may help new entrepreneurs in their onboarding providing useful information about cardano. Brand awareness is not enough to make people submit their ideas to Catalyst, so I still think it matches the challenge scope.
assessments.reply: The review states 2 times that we are addressing the Challenge ("...may help new entrepreneurs in their onboarding providing useful information about cardano." and "...I still think it matches the challenge scope."), but anyway we were rated with a 3.

assessments.note: I have checked their other sites, which seem to be working, thus I believe that they can deliver the final product. Also, this team is here for a while, responding to the comments in a broad and detailed way.

Because of the professionalism of the proposer and the proposal, I feel implementation will be successful if fully funded.  The team has a core of 6 people with diverse experience.  The ALDEA website is professional looking.  They are backed a DAO with stakepools and are obviously integrated into the Cardano community, which helps me feel confident in the proposals success
The team has already started working on the website and they seem to be experienced, knowledgeable and passionate about the project.

The proposers have been consistently contributing to the Cardano ecosystem. They have demonstrated expertise in content creation and hosting material. It is likely that they will be able to complete the project.
The experience presented is relevant to the proposal and the plan is detailed enough. There seems to be already a community around ALDEA which will make the maintenance of a wiki easier.

Feasibility - I like the budget, phases, and timeframe. 

Effectivity - metric how to measure relevant articles - here I am unsure, how they will do it, I have posted a comment with a question, waiting for response, Suggesting another metric - using a hyperlink (referral link, referral code) from ALDEA to CATALYST to track how many people became proposers because of ALDEA.

The three phase plan and the budget as listed show me that this proposal is feasible.  The budget is reasonable.  It will be clear how well the project is addressing the challenge by the numbers of engagement in the wiki.  I can easily see that a young Spanish speaking developer and entrepreneur and writer could meet thru this wiki and create something awesome.  This is exactly what the challenge is about.  Well done and I hope that you are funded.
The way they have addressed most issues in their proposal, I think they have planned well in advance and have enough experience and knowledge to get this project done.
Given the small amount of funds asked for, and the importance of providing information in Spanish if this is to become a global project, this seem like a valuable proposal.

The proposal is identifying the nonavailability of information in Spanish for attracting proposers and entrepreneurs to Catalyst. Wikipedia is the ideal platform with much better reach in the world. The proposal is not clear on what bases they have not considered Wikipedia.
assessments.reply: Although we have marked this review as "Constructive feedback" because we agree with it, we understand that this Advisor doesn't know about the problems that the Cardano Community and even Charles Hoskinson himself had with Wikipedia before.

assessments.note:
The plan is detailed enough and the budget is partitioned. Success metrics are defined as well as deliverables and a timeline.
The only downside is that phase 2 to 3 rely on successive fundings, that are not guaranteed, so there's the risk that only the spanish version will be built.

solution: ALDEA Wiki is the go-to place to both find and share knowledge and information about all things Cardano in a multi-language platform.
experience: Falcon Cardano Stakepool & ALDEA Core Team. Senior IT Geeks, Entrepreneurs, WyoHackathon Winners & Long-Term Cardano Advocates.
